candidates.name: Jeroen Jongejans
candidates.why_elect: I have been fortunate to have been in many governance positions on a local, regional and national level—from Conservation Board, a Whangarei Councillor, national tourism boards, numerous local organisations for over 30 years—own Dive! Tutukaka and learned many lessons to be a very effective representative for the community.
candidates.why_stand: Northland has been good for me, I want to give back and help to pass on an environment better than when I arrived 40 years ago—others before us have tried their best—now it is our turn—give the best back that we can!

candidates.name: Amy Macdonald
candidates.why_elect: I am a freshwater ecologist, with over a decade of experience working in conservation and environmental management. My professional background and personal values mean I can effectively represent the voices and values of our people, and future generations, in council.
candidates.why_stand: I am a mother to three young children, I want to help ensure future generations inherit healthy land and waterways so they can enjoy their natural environment and live a good life.

candidates.name: Colin Peter Thew
candidates.why_elect: I've had two terms previously in local government, facilitating close links between communities and council. My environmental management degree provides a perfect foundation for regional council governance. I am dedicated in everything I do, honest and a good communicator.
candidates.why_stand: On moving to Northland six years ago, I quickly fell in love with the region, and decided this is where I want to stay. I feel this is the right time to put my hat back in the ring, and re-enter local governance.

candidates.name: Maggie Buxton
candidates.why_elect: For over 25 years I have worked in NZ and globally supporting people, organisations and projects in the environmental, social and political spheres. I have experience in project management, facilitation and governance, a PhD in Creative Technology (AUT) and an MSc in Organisational Development (Sheffield Business School). I listen!
candidates.why_stand: I am standing to make a positive difference to a region that I love! I want clean rivers, a strong economy and engaged communities. I have the unique set of skills and experience make this happen. I will work hard to leave a positive legacy for the future.

candidates.name: Paul Dimery
candidates.why_elect: I have had the honour and privilege of being the elected member for the last six years. I was in the NZ Police for 35 years. I was the Area Commander for Whangarei/Kaipara for 12.5 years. I have strong ethics and integrity and I work for the community.
candidates.why_stand: Northland is one of the most beautiful regions in the world. I have been privileged to work and live in an environment that has brought me much happiness and a sense of fulfillment. I want my grandchildren to enjoy the natural resources as much I have.
